subject: Re: Redirect requested but followRedirects is disabled
msgSnippet: As said by David Saff, the best place for questions concerning htmlunit is really the htmlunit-user mailing list. In htmlunit (except perhaps if you use a very
messageBody:
As said by David Saff, the best place for questions concerning htmlunit is really the htmlunit-user mailing list.

In htmlunit (except perhaps if you use a very old release), you don't need to use WebClient.setRedirectEnabled(true) as
it is the default value. Messages like:

INFO: Redirect requested but followRedirects is disabled

come from commons-httpclient (used by htmlunit) and are normal and without signification because htmlunit handle itself
the redirections.

You get an exception because your server has sent a 501 error code and your WebClient is configured to throw in such a
case. If you set WebClient.setThrowExceptionOnFailingStatusCode(false), htmlunit should not throw anymore and would
follow the provided redirection.

Marc.
